noun.description: The state of not being used.
examples: the machines fell into disuse with the advent of computers

phrases: the old tracks fell into disuse and neglect
Over the past decade, large tracts of land like this, which farmers used to lease from the tribe, have fallen into disuse.
The Bund Signal Tower, which fell into disuse over 100 years ago, is to be pressed into service again.
Increasing load sizes led to the Kilmeade weighbridge falling into disuse and eventually being dismantled.
Between 1910 and 1920 or so, it fell into disuse and the gardens were basically abandoned.
